definition: on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: There was a thin curst of dirt around the bath.
sentences.chinese: 水面上浮有一层薄薄的油。

sentences.english: Product is only applicable to white paint system to reduce the color of floating and improve adhesion.
sentences.chinese: 产品只适用于白漆体系，减少颜色上浮，提高附着力。

sentences.english: Cool rises at the terrace rail, Lotus flowers'scent is clear, Wind from the water's face makes the wine face sober.
sentences.chinese: 西南月上浮云散轩槛凉生莲芰香清水面风来酒面醒。

sentences.english: And just allow that energy to come up and pass through.
sentences.chinese: 就只是让那股能量上浮离开吧。

sentences.english: In order to produce solely white sugar, technology of treating C-sugar remelt by floatation clarification was practiced.
sentences.chinese: 为了能全产白砂糖，应用了丙糖回溶上浮澄清工艺。

sentences.english: If so, you're your head down and just allow that energy to come up.
sentences.chinese: 如果是的话，就垂下头，允许那股能量上浮离开吧。

sentences.english: It even comes with a special rubber duck-shaped floating stand.
sentences.chinese: 它甚至装有一个特殊的橡胶鸭形上浮器。

sentences.english: If there is, just allow that energy to come up and pass through.
sentences.chinese: 如果有的话，还是允许那股能量上浮离开吧。

sentences.english: Let go of resisting and clutching and just allow that energy to pass through.
sentences.chinese: 把这些感受放下吧，让那股能量上浮离开。

sentences.english: Allow it to come up and pass through.
sentences.chinese: 就允许那股能量上浮离开吧。

definition: lit. to hang upside down/fig. topsy-turvy and inequitable, e.g. manufacturing and trading costs exceed the sale price (of some goods)/to borrow more than one can ever repay
(economics) to reduce/to curtail/to cut back/to tighten/austerity/tightening/crunch
norm/standard/standard of reference/base/base point/base line/benchmark/reference point/reference frame/criterion/data
to demote/to pass down to a lower unit
to adjust downwards/to lower (prices, wages etc)

pinyin: cun2 kuan3 zhun3 bei4 jin1 lu:4

definition: to lend money (as a commercial loan)
